definition.name: Toaster
definition.description: A client-side component that manages and displays toast notifications in the application. It renders a list of toast messages with optional titles, descriptions, and custom actions. Each toast can be dismissed via a close button.

properties.description: The component does not accept any direct props as it relies on the useToast hook for state management

definition.visualLayout: Renders a stack of toast notifications in a fixed position (typically top-right) of the viewport. Each toast contains an optional title, description, action button, and a close button in a grid layout.
interactions: Toasts can be closed by clicking the close button
Custom actions can be triggered through the action prop if provided
Multiple toasts can be displayed simultaneously and managed through the toast system
definition.implementationNotes: The component relies on the useToast hook for state management and requires ToastProvider to be present in the component tree. It maps through the toast array and renders individual Toast components with their respective properties.
